weapons.manuport: It looks like this rock wants a passage. As long as you keep it with you, it will protect you.
weapons.polarized sheet: It's a polarized sheet. It shows Fattuzu in light.
weapons.sharp polyhedron: You should never leave your house without a sharp polyhedron in your pocket.
weapons.armored manuport: << I'm a hitchhiker, can you give me a lift... please? >>
weapons.transparent polygon: Splits light into colored beams that blind enemies. Polarized sunglasses recommended.
weapons.armored brench: It looks the same as any armored branch you've seen before. It hurts a lot when used with dexterity.
weapons.ashpd: It looks like the Zero Point Energy Field Manipulator but besides lifting things it opens portals... Of course it doesn't work, but you can effectively slam it into things.
weapons.deliverance: Allow me to deliver my bullet to your head.
weapons.tesseract: Is an Optical Character Recognition tool. That is, it will recognize and read the text embedded in images. Did you think it was a deadly weapon like in The Cube?
weapons.great attractor: It's a gravitational anomaly in intergalactic space and the apparent central gravitational point of the Laniakea Supercluster.
weapons.soul Cube: Is an ancient Martian artifact and the most powerful weapon in Doom 3.

curses.self-luminous red: It's the impossible version of red.
curses.hyperbolic orange: It's the impossible version of orange.
curses.stygian blue: It's the impossible version of blue.
curses.method: << Car ce n'est pas assez d'avoir l'esprit bon, mais le principal est de l'appliquer bien.>>
curses.falsidical: Packs a surprise, but it is seen as a false alarm when we solve the underlying fallacy. Good for Easy Enemies.
curses.cluster point: A Cluster point of a set S in a topological space X is a point x that can be approximated by points of S: every neighbourhood of x also contains a point of S other than x itself. A limit point of a set S does not itself have to be an element of S.
curses.completeness: Every syntactically consistent, countable first-order theory has a finite or countable model. This establishes a correspondence between semantic truth and syntactic provability in first-order logic: GÃ¶del proved that first order logic is semantically complete but it is not syntactically complete, since there are sentences expressible in the language of first order logic that can be neither proved nor disproved from the axioms of logic alone.
curses.aleph: Cardinality of Reals. You see, the cartesian product of a countable number of countable set is uncountable.
curses.logistic map: Is a polynomial mapping of degree 2, often cited as an archetypal example of how complex, chaotic behaviour can arise from very simple non-linear dynamical equations.
curses.integral: A function of several real variables is a function with more than one argument, the input variables take real values, while the output may be real or complex.
curses.veridical: Packs a surprise, but the surprise quickly dissipates itself as we ponder the proof. Good for Medium enemies.
curses.comic sans: If you love it, you don't know much about typography. If you hate it, you really don't know much about typography either, and you should get another hobby.
curses.sep field: A SEP is something we can't see, or don't see, or our brain doesn't let us see, because we think that it's Somebody Else's Problem. The brain just edits it out, it's like a blind spot.
curses.nimby: Anywhere, but not in my back yard.
curses.choice: The cartesian product of non-empty sets is non-empty. Caution: may raise paradoxes.
curses.antinomy: Packs a surprise that can be accomodated by nothing less than a repudiation of part of our conceptual heritage. This is tough.
curses.continuum: There is no set whose cardinality is strictly between that of the integers and the real numbers.
curses.insult: Capable of crippling even the toughest pirate's ego.
curses.briefcase: <What's in the case?> <My boss's dirty laundry.> <Your boss makes you do his laundry?> <When he wants it cleaned.> <Sounds like a shit job.> <I was thinking the same thing.>

healers.modification: You could never live without it in a situation like this.
healers.gummy bears: They are full of glucose, perfect for synthesizing ATP.
healers.gommo: << What are these atrocious grimaces?> << What grimaces? >> << These!>> << Which ones? >> << The ones you are doing with your crippled mouth! >>
healers.ats: A liquid which is almost, but not quite, entirely unlike tea.
healers.mushrooms: These seemingly delicious mushrooms have a rather sus appearance...
healers.panna cotta: The panna cotta IS the message.

mana rechargers.potion2: Seriously, this stuff is tough. Please consume in moderation.
